name: http
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing HTTP cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`http` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-http).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing HTTP cloud resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-http)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-http` repo](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-http/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-http` repo](https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-http/issues).

python.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-http)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-http` repo](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-http/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-http` repo](https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-http/issues).

attempts.description: The number of times the request is to be retried. For example, if 2 is specified, the request will be tried a maximum of 3 times.

maxDelayMs.description: The maximum delay between retry requests in milliseconds.

minDelayMs.description: The minimum delay between retry requests in milliseconds.

provider.description:
The provider type for the http package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getHttp.

caCertPem.description: Certificate data of the Certificate Authority (CA) in [PEM (RFC 1421)](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc1421) format.

insecure.description: Disables verification of the server's certificate chain and hostname. Defaults to `false`

method.description: The HTTP Method for the request. Allowed methods are a subset of methods defined in [RFC7231](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7231#section-4.3) namely, `GET`, `HEAD`, and `POST`. `POST` support is only intended for read-only URLs, such as submitting a search.

requestBody.description: The request body as a string.

requestHeaders.description: A map of request header field names and values.

retry.description: Retry request configuration. By default there are no retries. Configuring this block will result in retries if an error is returned by the client (e.g., connection errors) or if a 5xx-range (except 501) status code is received. For further details see [go-retryablehttp](https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/hashicorp/go-retryablehttp).

url.description: The URL for the request. Supported schemes are `http.getHttp` and `https`.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getHttp.

body.description: The response body returned as a string. **NOTE**: This is deprecated, use `response_body` instead.

caCertPem.description: Certificate data of the Certificate Authority (CA) in [PEM (RFC 1421)](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc1421) format.

id.description: The URL used for the request.

insecure.description: Disables verification of the server's certificate chain and hostname. Defaults to `false`

method.description: The HTTP Method for the request. Allowed methods are a subset of methods defined in [RFC7231](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7231#section-4.3) namely, `GET`, `HEAD`, and `POST`. `POST` support is only intended for read-only URLs, such as submitting a search.

requestBody.description: The request body as a string.

requestHeaders.description: A map of request header field names and values.

responseBody.description: The response body returned as a string.

responseBodyBase64.description: The response body encoded as base64 (standard) as defined in [RFC 4648](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc4648#section-4).

responseHeaders.description: A map of response header field names and values. Duplicate headers are concatenated according to [RFC2616](https://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec4.html#sec4.2).

retry.description: Retry request configuration. By default there are no retries. Configuring this block will result in retries if an error is returned by the client (e.g., connection errors) or if a 5xx-range (except 501) status code is received. For further details see [go-retryablehttp](https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/hashicorp/go-retryablehttp).

url.description: The URL for the request. Supported schemes are `http.getHttp` and `https`.
